title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org
text: R package containing (eventually !) curated datasets MicrobiomeDB.org various helper functions conveniently using data R.

title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org
text: Use R package remotes install microbiomeData. R command prompt:
code: remotes::install_github('microbiomeDB/microbiomeData')

title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org
text: package used directly explore data ’ve downloaded MicrobiomeDB.org, used data management dependency another package.

title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org
text: can download data particular microbiome study MicrobiomeDB.org. Data files website organized ‘entity’, entities representing sample metadata others assay data. assay data organized ‘collections’ particular collection might example represent abundances particular taxonomic rank particular assay. column names assay data files prepended collection id. can pass lists files method called MbioDataset. can pass one list files entities representing sample metadata second list files entities representing assay data/ collections. can optionally pass ontology file containing mappings stable identifiers human-readable labels data. got files ‘Full Dataset’ Downloads section website, organized similarly enough, ’ll parse appropriate collections . might look something like : already read files R, can similar thing except passing lists data.frame data.table objects things work . myData, can ask specific collections dataset. might look something like:
code: myData <- MbioDataset(collections = list(fileA, fileB), metadata = list(fileD, fileE), ontology = fileZ) getCollectionNames(myData) # will print the names of collections myData <- updateCollectionName(myData, '16S-species', '16S Species') myCollection <- getCollection(myData, '16S Species')

title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org
text: package may used dependency R packages. order establish depedency developer dependent package must follow steps: 1. add microbiomeData Imports section dependent package’s DESCRIPTION file. 2. add Remotes section dependent package’s DESCRIPTION file. 3. add microbiomeDB/microbiomeData Remotes section dependent package’s DESCRIPTION file. 4. add #' @import microbiomeData dependent package’s package-level documentation file (usually called {mypackage}-package.R). 5. run devtools::document(). developer dependent package can either install package using remotes descripted “Installation” section , mean also develop microbiomeData simultaneously, can use devtools::load_all("{path--microbiomeData}") load package R session.

title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org
text: Pull requests welcome. major changes, please open issue first discuss like change. Please make sure update tests appropriate. trying add data dataset package, local machine : 1. Make sure devtools installed locally. 2. Clone repository make branch work . 3. Create MbioDataset object local R using ‘Direct Usage’ instructions . 4. Make sure new dataset collections, etc named well enough others use . 5. Use usethis::use_data add MbioDataset object package. sure ’re working branch made. 6. Add documentation dataset R/data.R following example: R    #' World Health Organization TB data    #'    #' subset data World Health Organization Global Tuberculosis    #' Report ...    #'    #' @format ## ``    #' data frame 7,240 rows 60 columns:    #' \describe{    #'   \item{country}{Country name}    #'   \item{iso2, iso3}{2 & 3 letter ISO country codes}    #'   \item{year}{Year}    #'   ...    #' }    #' @source <https://www..int/teams/global-tuberculosis-programme/data>    "" ## name `MbioDataset` object 7. Use devtools::document() generate man page MbioDataset. 8. Make Pull Request repo! See PR #11 example

title: Curated Data from MicrobiomeDB.org

title: Absolute Abundance Data — AbsoluteAbundanceData-class
text: class working count data microbial ecological assay.

title: Absolute Abundance Data — AbsoluteAbundanceData-class
text: data data.frame integer abundance counts species columns samples rows sampleMetadata data.frame metadata samples samples rows metadata variables columns recordIdColumn name column containing IDs samples. columns treated abundance values. ancestorIdColumns character vector column names representing parent entities recordIdColumn. imputeZero logical indicating whether NA/ null values replaced zeros.

title: Abundance Data — AbundanceData-class
text: class working microbiome ecological abundance data.

title: Abundance Data — AbundanceData-class
text: data data.frame abundance values species columns samples rows sampleMetadata SampleMetadata object metadata samples samples rows metadata variables columns recordIdColumn name column containing IDs samples. columns treated abundance values. ancestorIdColumns character vector column names representing parent entities recordIdColumn. imputeZero logical indicating whether NA/ null values replaced zeros. removeEmptySamples logical indicating whether empty (NA/ zero)samples removed.

title: BONUS-CF — BONUS
text: Baby Observational Nutrition Study (BONUS) set identify microbial correlates poor growth observed infants cystic fibrosis (CF) 207 infants diagnosed cystic fibrosis newborn screening Shotgun metagenomic sequencing 122 samples collected healthy controls, 1157 stool samples infants CF collected months 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10 12 life Longitudinal, observational, multicenter cohort study.

title: BONUS-CF — BONUS
code: BONUS

title: BONUS-CF — BONUS
text: MbioDataset object 23 metadata variables, 1279 WGS stool samples. contains following collections:  "WGS 4th level EC metagenome abundance data"  "WGS Metagenome enzyme pathway abundance data"  "WGS Metagenome enzyme pathway coverage data"   "WGS Genus"  "WGS Species"  "WGS Family"  "WGS Order"  "WGS Phylum"  "WGS Class"   "WGS Kingdom"   "WGS Normalized number taxon-specific sequence matches"

title: BONUS-CF — BONUS
text: https://microbiomedb.org/mbio/app/workspace/analyses/DS_b3b3ae9838/new/download

title: BONUS-CF — BONUS
text: Website Release 32. (2023 May 30)

title: Bangladesh 5yr — Bangladesh
text: study set define normal maturation gut microbiome first 5 years postnatal life. 55 members birth cohort consistently healthy anthropometric scores living within Mirpur district Dhaka, Bangladesh. 2415 stool samples; V4 region 16S rRNA gene. Prospective cohort design monthly sampling first ~5 years life.

code: Bangladesh

title: DiabImmune — DiabImmune
text: Broad Institute's study three pediatric cohorts examined microbiome children high risk development Type 1 diabetes (T1D). Includes 289 children across three sites, including Russia (Karelia), Finland Estonia. 3184 stool samples amplicon sequencing data V4 region 16S rRNA gene. 1149 stool samples 'shotgun' metagenomic sequencing data. Prospective cohort design monthly sampling first ~3 years life. Website Release 32. (2023 May 30)

title: DiabImmune — DiabImmune
code: DiabImmune

title: DiabImmune — DiabImmune
text: MbioDataset object 60 metadata variables, 3184 16S stool samples 1149 shotgun stool samples. contains following collections:  "16S Order"  "16S Genus"  "16S Family"  "16S Species"  "16S Class"  "16S Phylum"  "16S Kingdom"  "WGS 4th level EC metagenome abundance data"  "WGS Metagenome enzyme pathway abundance data"  "WGS Metagenome enzyme pathway coverage data"   "WGS Genus"  "WGS Species"  "WGS Family"  "WGS Order"  "WGS Phylum"  "WGS Class"   "WGS Kingdom"   "WGS Normalized number taxon-specific sequence matches"

title: FARMM — FARMM
text: Food Resulting Microbial Metabolites (FARMM) study set define impact defined diets microbiome metabolome. Follows 31 healthy human adult volunteers monitored longitudinaly 15 day period. Includes 454 stool samples sequencing controls; 'shotgun' metagenomic sequencing.

title: FARMM — FARMM
code: FARMM

title: FARMM — FARMM
